page.title: 18TRANSPORT IN THE D-BLOCK
page.content: {Public transport}is amply provided in our area. There are{buses}to all local communities and towns. We also have{4 {nearby railway stations}at{Wakefield (2) and{Pontefract}(2).{Taxis}are available from various places around our area but most people have their own{private transport,}namely{cars and{motorcycles. Motorcycles are very popular with the {young people of Purston,}where{1 in 5 owns one.{Maintenance}is provided at numerous{garages}in the area. Both{Wragby}and{Purston}suffer from {large volumes of freight traffic. Wragby is on a{main road}which carries large numbers of{heavy commercial {vehicles,}whilst Purston has 2 {factories}and 2{collieries}in its area , with large numbers of heavy goods vehicles travelling to and from them.
